com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution.impl
Class AbstractEvolutionStrategy<D,T>

java.lang.Object
  com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution.impl.AbstractEvolutionObject
      com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution.impl.AbstractEvolutionStrategy<D,T>
Type Parameters:
D - type of data used by Genomes
T - phenotype of Genomes
All Implemented Interfaces:
EvolutionObject, EvolutionStrategy<D,T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractNEATEvolutionStrategy, EvolutionStrategyImpl
public abstract class AbstractEvolutionStrategy<D,T>
extends AbstractEvolutionObject
implements EvolutionStrategy<D,T>

AbstractEvolutionStrategy implements the EvolutionStrategy interface. It runs a population of Genomes through the evolutionary process, using the given EvolutionFieldMap, EvaluationStrategy, ReproductionStrategy, and SurvivalFilter.

The evolutionary process begins with a single initialization step, evaluating each genome in the population. This is followed by repeated epoch steps, during which all genomes may participate in reproduction to population the next generation (though they likelihood of their reproducing is weighted by their fitness). Enough children are produced to replace those genomes that didn't survive the last generation. The population is evalutated again, and the process is repeated until the termination condition in EvolutionFieldMap is satisfied by the Population or the EvolutionStrategy instance itself.

At the end of initialization and each epoch, a report is made of the state of the population at that time, which may include writing files to the give output directory.

Subclasses may override this basic evolutionary behavior.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda

epoch

public void epoch(Population<D> population)
Evolves the given Population via mutation or crossover, reevaluates it, and performs any other processing.

Evolution proceeds as follows:

  1. Genomes are marked for death by the SurvivalFilter, but remain available for reproduction
  2. A number of children are produced equal to the number of genomes not surviving this generation
  3. The marked genomes are removed from the population and replaced by the children
  4. The population is evaluated
  5. The population's statis are updated and a report is made

Specified by:
epoch in interface EvolutionStrategy<D,T>
Parameters:
population - the collection of genomes to evolve for one generation
See Also:
EvolutionStrategy.epoch(Population)

initialize

public void initialize(Population<D> population)
Performs an initial evaluation and any pre-evolution processing on the given Population. This method is intended to be called once, before any evolution takes place.

Initialization proceeds as follows:

  1. The population is evaluated
  2. The population's statistics are updated and a report is made.

Specified by:
initialize in interface EvolutionStrategy<D,T>
Parameters:
population - the collection of genomes to initialize
See Also:
EvolutionStrategy.initialize(com.xtructure.xevolution.genetics.Population)
